decks.notes: This deck aims to control the game through a combination of countermagic, removal, and disruptive creatures like Psychic Frog. It utilizes powerful cards like Force of Will, Ancestral Recall, and Time Walk to gain card advantage and tempo. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing for recurring cheap threats and removal. With a focus on disrupting the opponent's game plan and maintaining control of the battlefield, this deck seeks to outlast and outmaneuver its opponents in order to secure victory.

The deck focuses on disruption and resource denial through counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, along with land destruction from Wasteland and Strip Mine. It also leverages card advantage with Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Treasure Cruise. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional value by allowing you to recur low-cost permanents. The deck's win conditions come from creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Orcish Bowmasters, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruption, card advantage, and strategic resource management.

This deck focuses on utilizing disruptive creatures like Collector Ouphe and Psychic Frog alongside powerful removal and counterspells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes efficient card draw and selection with cards like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Gitaxian Probe, as well as powerful threats like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Kishla Skimmer. The mana base is designed to support a mix of black, blue, and green spells, with utility lands like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This combo deck aims to set up a winning Doomsday pile using powerful draw spells and protection to win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck includes key cards like Doomsday, Thassa's Oracle, and Demonic Consultation to assemble the win condition quickly and efficiently. It also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo and winning the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The main concept of this Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo - Dredge deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, then utilize graveyard recursion effects such as Ichorid and Prized Amalgam to flood the board with creatures. By using cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder to manipulate the deck and graveyard, as well as disruption spells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect the combo, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful graveyard-based strategy.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources, utilizing counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while drawing cards and eventually winning with efficient threats like Psychic Frog and Orcish Bowmasters. It also utilizes powerful cards like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Dig Through Time to gain card advantage and manipulate the game. The inclusion of the companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows for additional value and resilience in longer games. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game and outvalue the opponent.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with hatebears, creatures that disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down the opponent's spells, the deck aims to disrupt their strategy while building a board presence with efficient creatures like White Plume Adventurer and Witch Enchanter. With additional hate cards like Void Mirror, Chalice of the Void, and Trinisphere, the deck aims to control the game and finish off the opponent with powerful finishers like Karn, the Great Creator and Clarion Conqueror.

This MUD Aggro deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with artifact acceleration and lands like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb to cast powerful threats like Glaring Fleshraker and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain. The deck also includes various artifact manipulation cards such as Voltaic Key, Manifold Key, and The One Ring to generate additional value and control the board. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive elements like Lodestone Golem and Karn, the Great Creator, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its efficient artifact-based strategy.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Aggro-MUD deck focuses on quickly assembling powerful artifacts, such as The One Ring and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain, to overwhelm the opponent. Using Mishra's Workshop and mana-producing artifacts like Sol Ring and the Moxen, the deck aims to rapidly deploy threats like Glaring Fleshraker and Scrawling Crawler while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Trinisphere and Pithing Needle. By leveraging powerful artifacts and artifact synergy cards like Mana Vault and Mystic Forge, this deck seeks to outpace and outmuscle opponents in the early game.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt opponents while steadily building card advantage and resource advantage. This is achieved through a combination of counter spells, removal, card draw, and resource denial. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value by allowing for recurring smaller threats or utility spells. The deck aims to outlast opponents through attrition and superior resource management, eventually overwhelming them with efficient threats and powerful spells.

Utilizing the graveyard as a resource, this deck aims to quickly fill it with powerful creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Prized Amalgam using cards like Golgari Thug and Stinkweed Imp. Bazaar of Baghdad helps to accelerate this process, while cards like Creeping Chill and Ichorid provide additional value when they are put into play from the graveyard. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Chalice of the Void to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies, making it a fast and powerful combo deck in Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The main idea of this Vintage 1 vs 1 Aggro-MUD deck is to quickly ramp up mana using artifacts like Grim Monolith and Mishra's Workshop, while controlling the opponent's resources with cards like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere. The deck aims to get ahead on board presence with creatures like Glaring Fleshraker, and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain, while also utilizing powerful artifact synergy with cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Mystic Forge. The deck also has combo potential with cards like Time Vault and Manifold Key to generate explosive turns and lock down the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control cards like Force of Will and Hullbreacher to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through cards like Ancestral Recall and Narset, Parter of Veils. It also utilizes artifacts like Mana Crypt and Moxen to ramp up quickly and cast powerful spells like Time Walk and Tinker. The inclusion of Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Karn, the Great Creator allows for versatility in dealing with different threats on the board. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent with its efficient spells and artifacts.

The deck focuses on assembling the Coveted Jewel combo by using powerful mana ramp cards like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb to quickly play out key pieces like The One Ring and Coveted Jewel. It utilizes control cards like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal is to generate immense value and card advantage with cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain while efficiently finding ways to untap Time Vault with cards like Manifold Key and Karn, the Great Creator.

The deck focuses on using powerful artifacts and mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The goal is to control the game by locking down opponent's resources while establishing a strong board presence with efficient threats. The synergy between artifacts like Mishra's Workshop, Sol Ring, and Moxen enable explosive starts and continuous pressure, while cards like Trinisphere and Karn, the Great Creator disrupt opponent's game plan. The deck aims to close out the game quickly with high-powered creatures like Glaring Fleshraker and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Gifts Ungiven card to search for key spells or combo pieces to control the game. With cards like Underworld Breach and Lrien Revealed to enable powerful plays, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent with counterspells like Force of Will and Mana Drain while also building up its own resources with cards like Time Walk and Tolarian Academy. The inclusion of powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen provide additional mana acceleration to support the deck's control strategy while also utilizing win conditions like Brain Freeze or Consign to Memory to close out the game.
